revised_title: A Microscopic Study of the Eyes of the Monoculus Polyphemus
tldr: The author examines the unique eye structure of the Monoculus Polyphemus, a type of king crab, and discovers that the large eyes consist of numerous small, transparent, amber-colored cones, while the small eyes have a single cone. The study provides insight into the visual capabilities of this crustacean species.
